gost_params.scope of application: GOST is applied in defining the complete coverage of Scopus, including the expansion of humanities titles and book coverage.

Books: Must have a coverage varying from 0.1 to 11.6% depending on the field of study
Journal articles: Includes original research or opinion articles
Conference papers: Focus on areas like engineering and computer science

requirements.Humanities titles: Includes 3,500 titles (4,200 humanities-related titles) and 116,000 book titles added since 2014.
requirements.Arts & Humanities titles: Part of the social sciences subject cluster and can be excluded or limited in search results.
requirements.Book titles: Over 55% of added books represent arts & humanities and social sciences.
requirements.Cited references: Going back to 1970 through the Cited Reference Expansion project.
requirements.Abstracts: 73% of articles have an abstract dating back to 1823.
requirements.Journals from various publishers: Back files (pre-1996) from publishers are added when available.

scopus_title_list.Scopus Journals title list: Contains over 34,000 titles in total, including over 21,500 active titles and over 12,000 inactive titles. Scopus Books title list contains more than 116,000 books

funding_data.Sponsor name: Mentioned in the acknowledgement section of the article
funding_data.Acronym: Available from the acknowledgement section on the relevant record page
funding_data.Grant number: Available from the acknowledgement section on the relevant record page, if mentioned and funding body is included in FundRef ontology

open_access.Journals registration: Registered as Gold OA or Subsidized OA at Directory of Open Access Journals or Directory of Open Access Scholarly Resources
open_access.Note: Open access is registered on journal level and not on article level

title_evaluation.Sources of suggestions: Librarians, publishers, and journal editors can submit title suggestions through the Title Suggestion form on the Scopus info site
Eligibility criteria: Regular publication with an ISSN number
Relevant and readable for an international audience

Metrics and benchmarks.Self-citations: 200% higher self-citation rate compared to peer journals
Metrics and benchmarks.Citations: 50% less citations compared to peer journals
Metrics and benchmarks.Impact Per Publication: IPP score half or less than average IPP score of peer journals
Metrics and benchmarks.Article output: Half or less number of articles compared to peer journals
Metrics and benchmarks.Abstract usage: Abstracts used half or less compared to peer journals
Metrics and benchmarks.Full text links: Full text links used half or less compared to peer journals

Procedure: Journals receive pre-warning if not meeting benchmarks
Re-evaluation based on set criteria by CSAB member, potential discontinuation in Scopus
